snippet: Cuba is one of 21 countries participating for the first time in the 19th Maccabiah Games, a quadrennial international sporting event known as the Jewish Olympics.
abstract: Rishon LeZion Journal; 56 Jewish Cuban athletes will compete in Israel's Maccabiah Games, quadrennial international sporting event known as Jewish Olympics, located in Rishon LeZion; group is Cuba's first official delegation to event and its presence there was made possible due to relaxed travel restrictions for large groups leaving Havana.

byline.original: By ALYZA SEBENIUS and HILLEL KUTTLER
byline.contributor: Alyza Sebenius reported from Rishon LeZion, and Hillel Kuttler from Jerusalem. Sam Borden contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Cuba is one of 21 countries participating for the first time in the 19th Maccabiah Games, a quadrennial international sporting event known as the Jewish Olympics.

headline.main: Cuban Jews Find an Israeli Olympics With a Higher Purpose
headline.print_headline: Cuban Jews Find an Israeli Olympics With a Higher Purpose
